verses.verse: Now the people <S%H5971><s%> became <S%H1961><s%> like those who complain <S%H596><s%> of adversity <S%H9563><s%> in the hearing <S%H241><s%> of the Lord; <S%H3068><s%> and when the Lord <S%H3068><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> [it,] His anger <S%H639><s%> was kindled, <S%H2734><s%> and the fire <S%H784><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> burned <S%H1197><s%> among them and consumed <S%H398><s%> [some] of the outskirts <S%H7097><s%> of the camp. <S%H4264><s%>

The people <S%H5971><s%> therefore cried <S%H6817><s%> out to Moses, <S%H4872><s%> and Moses <S%H4872><s%> prayed <S%H6419><s%> to the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> and the fire <S%H784><s%> died <S%H8257><s%> out.

So the name <S%H8034><s%> of that place <S%H4725><s%> was called <S%H7121><s%> Taberah, <S%H8404><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> the fire <S%H784><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> burned <S%H1197><s%> among them.

And the rabble <S%H628><s%> who <S%H834><s%> were among <S%H7130><s%> them had <S%H183><s%> greedy <S%H8378><s%> desires <S%H183><s%>; <S%H8378><s%> and also <S%H1571><s%> the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> wept <S%H1058><s%> again <S%H7725><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> "Who <S%H4310><s%> will give us meat <S%H1320><s%> to eat <S%H398><s%>?

"We remember <S%H2142><s%> the fish <S%H1710><s%> which <S%H834><s%> we used to eat <S%H398><s%> free <S%H2600><s%> in Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> the cucumbers <S%H7180><s%> and the melons <S%H20><s%> and the leeks <S%H2682><s%> and the onions <S%H1211><s%> and the garlic, <S%H7762><s%>

but now <S%H6258><s%> our appetite <S%H5315><s%> is gone. <S%H3002><s%> There <S%H369><s%> is nothing <S%H369><s%> at all <S%H3605><s%> to look <S%H5869><s%> at except <S%H1115><s%> this manna. <S%H4478><s%> "
Now the manna <S%H4478><s%> was like coriander <S%H1407><s%> seed, <S%H2233><s%> and its appearance <S%H5869><s%> like that of bdellium. <S%H916><s%>

The people <S%H5971><s%> would go <S%H7751><s%> about <S%H7751><s%> and gather <S%H3950><s%> [it] and grind <S%H2912><s%> [it] between two millstones <S%H7347><s%> or <S%H176><s%> beat <S%H1743><s%> [it] in the mortar, <S%H4085><s%> and boil <S%H1310><s%> [it] in the pot <S%H6517><s%> and make <S%H6213><s%> cakes <S%H5692><s%> with it; and its taste <S%H2940><s%> was as the taste <S%H2940><s%> of cakes <S%H3955><s%> baked <S%H3955><s%> with oil. <S%H8081><s%>
And when the dew <S%H2919><s%> fell <S%H3381><s%> on the camp <S%H4264><s%> at night, <S%H3915><s%> the manna <S%H4478><s%> would fall <S%H3381><s%> with it.

Now Moses <S%H4872><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> weeping <S%H1058><s%> throughout their families, <S%H4940><s%> each <S%H376><s%> man <S%H376><s%> at the doorway <S%H6607><s%> of his tent; <S%H168><s%> and the anger <S%H639><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> was kindled <S%H2734><s%> greatly, <S%H3966><s%> and Moses <S%H4872><s%> was displeased. <S%H7489><s%> <S%H5869><s%>

So Moses <S%H4872><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> "Why <S%H4100><s%> hast Thou been so hard <S%H7489><s%> on Thy servant <S%H5650><s%>? And why <S%H4100><s%> have I not found <S%H4672><s%> favor <S%H2580><s%> in Thy sight, <S%H5869><s%> that Thou hast laid <S%H7760><s%> the burden <S%H4853><s%> of all <S%H3605><s%> this <S%H2088><s%> people <S%H5971><s%> on me?

"Was it I who conceived <S%H2029><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> this <S%H2088><s%> people <S%H5971><s%>? Was it I who brought <S%H3205><s%> them forth, <S%H3205><s%> that Thou shouldest say <S%H559><s%> to me, 'Carry <S%H5375><s%> them in your bosom <S%H2436><s%> as a nurse <S%H539><s%> carries <S%H5375><s%> a nursing <S%H3243><s%> infant, <S%H3243><s%> to the land <S%H127><s%> which <S%H834><s%> Thou didst swear <S%H7650><s%> to their fathers'?

"Where <S%H4480><s%> <S%H370><s%> am I to get meat <S%H1320><s%> to give <S%H5414><s%> to all <S%H3605><s%> this <S%H2088><s%> people <S%H5971><s%>? For they weep <S%H1058><s%> before <S%H5921><s%> me, saying, <S%H559><s%> 'Give <S%H5414><s%> us meat <S%H1320><s%> that we may eat! <S%H398><s%>'

"I alone <S%H905><s%> am not able <S%H3201><s%> to carry <S%H5375><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> this <S%H2088><s%> people, <S%H5971><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> it is too <S%H4480><s%> burdensome <S%H3515><s%> for me.

"So if <S%H518><s%> Thou art going to deal <S%H6213><s%> thus <S%H3602><s%> with me, please <S%H4994><s%> kill <S%H2026><s%> me at once, <S%H2026><s%> if <S%H518><s%> I have found <S%H4672><s%> favor <S%H2580><s%> in Thy sight, <S%H5869><s%> and do not let me see <S%H7200><s%> my wretchedness. <S%H9567><s%>"

The Lord <S%H3068><s%> therefore said <S%H559><s%> to Moses, <S%H4872><s%> "Gather <S%H622><s%> for Me seventy <S%H7657><s%> men <S%H376><s%> from the elders <S%H2205><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> whom <S%H834><s%> you know <S%H3045><s%> to be the elders <S%H2205><s%> of the people <S%H5971><s%> and their officers <S%H7860><s%> and bring <S%H3947><s%> them to the tent <S%H168><s%> of meeting, <S%H4150><s%> and let them take <S%H3320><s%> their stand <S%H3320><s%> there <S%H8033><s%> with you.

"Then I will come <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> and speak <S%H1696><s%> with you there, <S%H8033><s%> and I will take <S%H680><s%> of the Spirit <S%H7307><s%> who <S%H834><s%> is upon you, and will put <S%H7760><s%> [Him] upon them; and they shall bear <S%H5375><s%> the burden <S%H4853><s%> of the people <S%H5971><s%> with you, so that you shall not bear <S%H5375><s%> [it] all alone. <S%H905><s%>

"And say <S%H559><s%> to the people, <S%H5971><s%> 'Consecrate <S%H6942><s%> yourselves for tomorrow, <S%H4279><s%> and you shall eat <S%H398><s%> meat; <S%H1320><s%> for you have wept <S%H1058><s%> in the ears <S%H241><s%> of the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> "Oh <S%H4310><s%> that someone <S%H4310><s%> would give us meat <S%H1320><s%> to eat! <S%H398><s%> For we were well-off in Egypt. <S%H4714><s%> "Therefore the Lord <S%H3068><s%> will give <S%H5414><s%> you meat <S%H1320><s%> and you shall eat. <S%H398><s%>

'You shall eat, <S%H398><s%> not one <S%H259><s%> day, <S%H3117><s%> nor <S%H3808><s%> two days, <S%H3117><s%> nor <S%H3808><s%> five <S%H2568><s%> days, <S%H3117><s%> nor <S%H3808><s%> ten <S%H6235><s%> days, <S%H3117><s%> nor <S%H3808><s%> twenty <S%H6242><s%> days, <S%H3117><s%>

but a whole <S%H3117><s%> month, <S%H2320><s%> until <S%H5704><s%> <S%H834><s%> it comes <S%H3318><s%> out of your nostrils <S%H639><s%> and becomes <S%H1961><s%> loathsome <S%H2214><s%> to you; because <S%H3282><s%> <S%H3588><s%> you have rejected <S%H3988><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> who <S%H834><s%> is among <S%H7130><s%> you and have wept <S%H1058><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> Him, saying, <S%H559><s%> "Why <S%H4100><s%> did we ever <S%H2088><s%> leave <S%H3318><s%> <S%H4480><s%> Egypt <S%H4714><s%>?"' "

But Moses <S%H4872><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "The people, <S%H5971><s%> among <S%H7130><s%> whom <S%H834><s%> I am, are 600000 on foot; <S%H7273><s%> yet Thou hast said, <S%H559><s%> 'I will give <S%H5414><s%> them meat <S%H1320><s%> in order that they may eat <S%H398><s%> for a whole <S%H3117><s%> month. <S%H2320><s%>'

"Should flocks <S%H6629><s%> and herds <S%H1241><s%> be slaughtered <S%H7819><s%> for them, to be sufficient <S%H4672><s%> for them? Or <S%H518><s%> should all <S%H3605><s%> the fish <S%H1709><s%> of the sea <S%H3220><s%> be gathered <S%H622><s%> together for them, to be sufficient <S%H4672><s%> for them?"

And the Lord <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Moses, <S%H4872><s%> "Is the Lord's power <S%H3027><s%> limited <S%H9527><s%>? Now <S%H6258><s%> you shall see <S%H7200><s%> whether My word <S%H1697><s%> will come <S%H7136><s%> true <S%H7136><s%> for you or <S%H518><s%> not."

So Moses <S%H4872><s%> went <S%H3318><s%> out and told <S%H1696><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> the words <S%H1697><s%> of the Lord. <S%H3068><s%> Also, he gathered <S%H622><s%> seventy <S%H7657><s%> men <S%H376><s%> of the elders <S%H2205><s%> of the people, <S%H5971><s%> and stationed <S%H5975><s%> them around <S%H5439><s%> the tent. <S%H168><s%>

Then the Lord <S%H3068><s%> came <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> in the cloud <S%H6051><s%> and spoke <S%H1696><s%> to him; and He took <S%H680><s%> of the Spirit <S%H7307><s%> who <S%H834><s%> was upon him and placed <S%H5414><s%> [Him] upon the seventy <S%H7657><s%> elders. <S%H2205><s%> And it came <S%H1961><s%> about that when the Spirit <S%H7307><s%> rested <S%H5117><s%> upon them, they prophesied. <S%H5012><s%> But they did not do <S%H3254><s%> [it] again. <S%H3254><s%>

But two <S%H8147><s%> men <S%H376><s%> had remained <S%H7604><s%> in the camp; <S%H4264><s%> the name <S%H8034><s%> of one <S%H259><s%> was Eldad <S%H419><s%> and the name <S%H8034><s%> of the other <S%H8145><s%> Medad. <S%H4312><s%> And the Spirit <S%H7307><s%> rested <S%H5117><s%> upon them (now they were among those who had been registered, <S%H3789><s%> but had not gone <S%H3318><s%> out to the tent <S%H168><s%>), and they prophesied <S%H5012><s%> in the camp. <S%H4264><s%>

So a young <S%H5288><s%> man <S%H5288><s%> ran <S%H7323><s%> and told <S%H5046><s%> Moses <S%H4872><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> "Eldad <S%H419><s%> and Medad <S%H4312><s%> are prophesying <S%H5012><s%> in the camp. <S%H4264><s%>"

Then Joshua <S%H3091><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Nun, <S%H5126><s%> the attendant <S%H8334><s%> of Moses <S%H4872><s%> from his youth, <S%H979><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> "Moses, <S%H4872><s%> my lord, <S%H113><s%> restrain <S%H3607><s%> them."

But Moses <S%H4872><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to him, "Are you jealous <S%H7065><s%> for my sake? Would <S%H4310><s%> <S%H5414><s%> that all <S%H3605><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%>'s people <S%H5971><s%> were prophets, <S%H5030><s%> that the Lord would put <S%H5414><s%> His Spirit <S%H7307><s%> upon them!"
Then Moses <S%H4872><s%> returned <S%H622><s%> to the camp, <S%H4264><s%> [both] he and the elders <S%H2205><s%> of Israel. <S%H3478><s%>

Now there went <S%H5265><s%> forth <S%H5265><s%> a wind <S%H7307><s%> from the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> and it brought <S%H1468><s%> quail <S%H7958><s%> from the sea, <S%H3220><s%> and let [them] fall <S%H5203><s%> beside <S%H5921><s%> the camp, <S%H4264><s%> about a day's journey <S%H1870><s%> on this <S%H3541><s%> side <S%H3541><s%> and a day's journey <S%H1870><s%> on the other <S%H3541><s%> side, <S%H3541><s%> all <S%H5439><s%> around <S%H5439><s%> the camp, <S%H4264><s%> and about two cubits <S%H520><s%> [deep] on the surface <S%H6440><s%> of the ground. <S%H776><s%>

And the people <S%H5971><s%> spent <S%H6965><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> night <S%H3915><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> the next <S%H4283><s%> day, <S%H3117><s%> and gathered <S%H622><s%> the quail <S%H7958><s%> (he who gathered least <S%H4591><s%> gathered <S%H622><s%> ten <S%H6235><s%> homers <S%H9149><s%>) and they spread <S%H7849><s%> [them] out for themselves all <S%H5439><s%> around <S%H5439><s%> the camp. <S%H4264><s%>

While the meat <S%H1320><s%> was still <S%H5750><s%> between <S%H996><s%> their teeth, <S%H8127><s%> before <S%H2962><s%> it was chewed, <S%H3772><s%> the anger <S%H639><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> was kindled <S%H2734><s%> against the people, <S%H5971><s%> and the Lord <S%H3068><s%> struck <S%H5221><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> with a very <S%H3966><s%> severe <S%H7227><s%> plague. <S%H4347><s%>

So the name <S%H8034><s%> of that place <S%H4725><s%> was called <S%H7121><s%> Kibroth-hattaavah, because <S%H3588><s%> there <S%H8033><s%> they buried <S%H6912><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> who had been <S%H183><s%> greedy. <S%H183><s%>
From Kibroth-hattaavah the people <S%H5971><s%> set <S%H5265><s%> out for Hazeroth, <S%H2698><s%> and they remained <S%H1961><s%> at Hazeroth. <S%H2698><s%>
